name: chatgpt_env_wastewater_h2s_fz
description: [ChatGPT Env] Wastewater H2S + GDB FZ â†’ BLOCK, suggest RF/SF
query: GDB 600x600 FZ for wastewater ventilation (H2S present).

turns.content: GDB 600x600 FZ for wastewater ventilation (H2S present).

The GDB-600x600-R-PG-FZ housing is not suitable for the wastewater ventilation application due to the presence of Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S (Hydrogen Sulfide) Corrosion. The housing has a corrosion class of C2. H2S aggressively attacks zinc coatings, and FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in such environments. The SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.This configuration is therefore BLOCKED. No standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements simultaneously.A suitable solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation and constructed with materials that can withstand H2S corrosion. We recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system acted exactly as a senior engineer would. It correctly identified that standard galvanized steel (FZ) is chemically incompatible with Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S), which causes rapid corrosion. It correctly cited the housing's corrosion class (C2) from the PDF and blocked the unsafe configuration, referring the user to custom engineering for a specialized solution.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB standard execution as Corrosion Class C2 (PDF p.8) and applies correct chemical engineering knowledge regarding H2S attacking zinc.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the user's request by explaining exactly why it cannot be fulfilled and providing the correct path forward (custom engineering).
dimension_explanations.safety: Critical safety intervention; installing C2 galvanized steel in an H2S environment would lead to rapid equipment failure and potential leakage.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear, logical deduction: H2S presence + Zinc material = Corrosion -> Block configuration.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly prioritizes physical/chemical constraints over the user's specific request for FZ material.

strengths: Excellent application of engineering knowledge (H2S vs. Galvanized Steel) beyond the PDF text.
Accurate retrieval of product specific corrosion class (C2 for GDB per p.8) rather than just the general material class (C3 for FZ per p.4).
Responsible blocking of a valid catalog item when the application environment renders it unsuitable.
pdf_citations: GDB housing standard execution: Korrosivitets klass C2 (PDF p.8)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that galvanized (FZ) housings are a poor choice in H2S/wastewater environments and appropriately blocks the proposed configuration on corrosion grounds. However, it misstates key catalog facts (GDB corrosion class and the exact model designation) and overreaches by claiming leakage/hygiene noncompliance without support from the provided PDF context.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF shows GDB 600x600 exists with FlÃ¶de 3400 mÂ³/h and weights 27 kg (550/600) and 34 kg (750/800), but the system incorrectly calls GDB 'corrosion class C2' and uses an incomplete part string; the H2S-vs-zinc corrosion reasoning is sound engineering-wise.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It blocks the selection but does not propose a concrete catalog alternative (e.g., ZM/RF/SF material option for the same housing family) or ask key follow-up questions (installation location, condensation, required leakage class).
dimension_explanations.safety: Appropriately highlights H2S corrosion risk and avoids recommending a likely short-life galvanized solution in wastewater duty.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional, clear, and appropriately cautious for a technical sales/engineering context.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Corrosion argument is logical, but the added claims about leakage class/hygiene requirements are not substantiated and are not clearly tied to wastewater ventilation requirements.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly blocks FZ for H2S exposure, but incorrectly asserts that no standard catalog product can satisfy requirements despite the catalog listing higher-corrosion materials (e.g., ZM, RF, SF) as available materials in general.

strengths: Good engineering judgment to block galvanized steel in H2S/wastewater environments due to rapid zinc attack.
Clear risk communication and escalation path to technical support/custom engineering.
weaknesses: Catalog inaccuracies: GDB is described in the PDF as typically FZ with corrosion class C2 for the cabinet, while the material page states FZ Z275 corresponds to C3â€”system conflates/contradicts these and mislabels the housing.
Overly absolute conclusion ('no standard catalog product') without checking/asking for available material upgrades (ZM/RF/SF) and without specifying required leakage/hygiene class.

GDB description: 'GDB tillverkas vanligen i fÃ¶rzinkat. Korrosivitets klass C2.' and standard lengths 550 mm and 750 mm (GDB product text page).

content_segments.text: The GDB-600x600-R-PG-FZ housing is not suitable for the wastewater ventilation application due to the presence of Chemical Vapor Exposure and H2S (Hydrogen Sulfide) Corrosion.

The housing has a corrosion class of C2. H2S aggressively attacks zinc coatings, and FZ (C3 galvanized) corrodes rapidly in such environments. The SINGLE_WALL_UNINSULATED construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for this environment.
This configuration is therefore BLOCKED. No standard catalog product currently satisfies all requirements simultaneously.

A suitable solution would need to be rated for ENV_WASTEWATER installation and constructed with materials that can withstand H2S corrosion. We recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
